## Rules to Follow

<!-- - You must always commit your changes whenever you update code.  -->
- Include docstrings in Scipy/Numpy format for all functions.
- You must only work on a single feature at a time.
- You must explain your decisions thouroughly to the user.
- Use uv for library and environment management.
- When explaining code, include a small sample scenario with code to illustrate.
- When creating documentation explain how the code works, and how it's orchestrated. include a flow diagram
- When creating documentation, include the function name, a brief description of what it does, specify inputs and outputs. Specify if any of the inputs are external files.
- When creating documentation include these sections: Environment Setup, Environment Variables, Directory Structure, Usage Guide, Flow Diagram.
- When creating documentation do not include packages/libraries required.
- When creating documentation specify if the function requires an external file as input.
